body.p: This section explains the settings available for the XSLT/XQuery Profiler. To access and modify these settings, and go to XML XSLT-XQuery Profiler (see ).

The following profiler settings are available:
Show time Shows the total time that was spent in the call.
Show inherent time Shows the inherent time that was spent in the call. The inherent time is defined as the total time of a call minus the time of its child calls.
Show invocation count Shows how many times the call was called in this particular call sequence.
Time scale Determines the unit of time measurement. You can choose between milliseconds or microseconds.
Hotspot threshold Hotspots are ignored below this specified amount (in milliseconds). For more information, see .
Ignore invocation less than Invocations are ignored below this specified amount (in microseconds). For more information, see .
Percentage calculation The percentage base that determines what time span percentages are calculated against. You can choose between the following:
Absolute - Percentage values show the contribution to the total time.
Relative - Percentage values show the contribution to the calling call.
